item.title: Michelle add a quote by Robert Frost
item.description: "Never be bullied into silence. Never allow yourself to be made a victim. Accept no one’s definition of your life; define yourself." -- Robert Frost

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Robert Frost
item.description: "Writing free verse is like playing tennis with the net down." -- Robert Frost

item.title: Michelle add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "Friendship is born at that moment when one man says to another: "What! You too? I thought that no one but myself . . .&#34;" -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "You know you're in love when you can't fall asleep because reality is finally better than your dreams." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Narcotics Anonymous
item.description: "Insanity is doing the same thing, over and over again, but expecting different results." -- Narcotics Anonymous

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Mae West
item.description: "You only live once, but if you do it right, once is enough." -- Mae West

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Eleanor Roosevelt
item.description: "A woman is like a tea bag; you never know how strong it is until it's in hot water." -- Eleanor Roosevelt

item.title: Michelle add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "The fool doth think he is wise, but the wise man knows himself to be a fool." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "A lady's imagination is very rapid; it jumps from admiration to love, from love to matrimony in a moment." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "The person, be it gentleman or lady, who has not pleasure in a good novel, must be intolerably stupid." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "Friendship is certainly the finest balm for the pangs of disappointed love." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "The more I know of the world, the more I am convinced that I shall never see a man whom I can really love. I require so much!" -- Jane Austen

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description:
"I can listen no longer in silence. I must speak to you by such means as are within my reach. You pierce my soul. I am half agony, half hope. Tell me not that I am too late, that such precious feelings are gone for ever. I offer myself to you again with a heart even more your own than when you almost broke it, eight years and a half ago. Dare not say that man forgets sooner than woman, that his love has an earlier death. I have loved none but you. Unjust I may have been, weak and resentful I have been, but never inconstant. You alone have brought me to Bath. For you alone, I think and plan. Have you not seen this? Can you fail to have understood my wishes? I had not waited even these ten days, could I have read your feelings, as I think you must have penetrated mine. I can hardly write. I am every instant hearing something which overpowers me. You sink your voice, but I can distinguish the tones of that voice when they would be lost on others. Too good, too excellent creature! You do us justice, indeed. You do believe that there is true attachment and constancy among men. Believe it to be most fervent, most undeviating, in F. W.
I must go, uncertain of my fate; but I shall return hither, or follow your party, as soon as possible. A word, a look, will be enough to decide whether I enter your father's house this evening or never." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Dodie Smith
item.description: "How I wish I lived in a Jane Austen novel!" -- Dodie Smith

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Kristin Hannah
item.description: "That was the thing about best friends. Like sisters and mothers, they could piss you off and make you cry and break your heart, but in the end, when the chips were down, they were there, making you laugh even in your darkest hours. " -- Kristin Hannah

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Elizabeth Barrett Browning
item.description: "How do I love thee? Let me count the ways. I love thee to the depth and breadth and height My soul can reach" -- Elizabeth Barrett Browning

item.title: Michelle add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "When I said I would die a bachelor, I did not think I should live till I were married." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Harper Lee
item.description: "Until I feared I would lose it, I never loved to read. One does not love breathing." -- Harper Lee

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Deborah Reber
item.description: "Letting go doesn't mean that you don't care about someone anymore. It's just realizing that the only person you really have control over is yourself." -- Deborah Reber

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Debra Cox
item.description: "So I placed my heart under lock and key To take some time, and take care of me But I turn around and you're standing here" -- Debra Cox

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Linda Grayson
item.description: "There is nothing better than a friend, unless it is a friend with chocolate." -- Linda Grayson

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Sarah Dessen
item.description: "Life is an awful, ugly place to not have a best friend." -- Sarah Dessen

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "Finish each day and be done with it. You have done what you could. Some blunders and absurdities no doubt crept in; forget them as soon as you can. Tomorrow is a new day. You shall begin it serenely and with too high a spirit to be encumbered with your old nonsense." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Sarah Dessen
item.description: "Love is needing someone. Love is putting up with someone's bad qualities because they somehow complete you." -- Sarah Dessen

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Sarah Dessen
item.description: "I wondered which was harder, in the end. The act of telling, or who you told it to. Or maybe if, when you finally got it out, the story was really all that mattered." -- Sarah Dessen

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Sarah Dessen
item.description: "You can't make any one person your world. The trick is to take what each can give you and build a world from it." -- Sarah Dessen

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Cristina Marrero
item.description: "You had to be willing to fight in order for a love story to last a life time." -- Cristina Marrero

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Cristina Marrero
item.description: "So, let me get this straight-- You want me to stop being a lesbian and being attracted to women because it is a 'sin'? Last time I checked, when you lie you are sinning. Sure, I could tell you I am no longer a lesbian or that I am no longer attracted to women and am straight, or I could even tell you the moon is made of cheese. I could tell you many things, but the moon will still not be made of cheese, and I will still not be attracted to men. I could tell you a lie in order to placate you, but isn’t the truth supposed to set me free? I choose truth over lies any day of the week. " -- Cristina Marrero

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Jodi Picoult
item.description: "There were two ways to be happy: improve your reality, or lower your expectations" -- Jodi Picoult

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Eric Hoffer
item.description: "Disappointment is a sort of bankruptcy - the bankruptcy of a soul that expends too much in hope and expectation." -- Eric Hoffer
